question.body: All of these are arteries that are perfused by branches of the abdominal aorta except __________.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The renal arteries supply the kidneys, which are abdominal organs.
Incorrect. The mesentery is a fold in the peritoneal membrane of the abdominopelvic cavity.
Incorrect. The gonads (ovaries or testes) are pelvic structures.
Correct. Intercostal arteries supply the intercostal muscles that are found between the ribs. These arteries are derived from the thoracic aorta.

part.hint: Which vessel name is not associated with an abdominopelvic structure?
